pageContext.claim: “And you look at your border security, what I've had to do on border security. We got rid of -- all they have to do is the loopholes. Mexico has been fantastic. Your numbers are way, way down in a positive way. Way, way down. But we've done it without any Democrat help, which is a shame.”
pageContext.analysis: Apprehensions of undocumented migrants are down, according to data from U.S. Customs and Border Protection, but that was after a huge spike in apprehensions earlier in fiscal 2019. The fiscal year ended with around the same number of apprehensions per month as the beginning of the year. The number was similar to how fiscal 2016 and 2018 ended.
